intro: Potamogeton pusillus var. minutissimus, commonly known as the minute pondweed, is a small aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in North America. It is characterized by its tiny, narrow leaves that are typically less than 1 millimeter in width. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often submerged, and it reproduces both sexually and asexually through rhizomes. It thrives in shallow, slow-moving waters and is an important part of aquatic ecosystems. Its presence can indicate good water quality due to its sensitivity to pollution.
